metadata.title: Integrated Weather, Geospatial, and Seismic Data Analysis for Natural Hazard Monitoring

abstract.text: Natural hazard monitoring requires the integration of atmospheric, geospatial, and seismic data. This paper presents a unified framework for analyzing weather patterns, spatial terrain data, and seismic activity.

body_text.text: Extreme weather events and seismic activity often interact with geographical features, influencing disaster severity and impact.
GIS platforms were used to combine satellite weather data, terrain elevation models, and seismic wave records into a unified spatial framework.
Integrated analysis improves early warning systems by identifying high-risk zones for floods, landslides, and earthquakes.
